rComments: Klett is a great teacher. He is enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and really enjoyable to listen to. His lectures are relatable and intriguing. He always encourages people to speak up in class. Only complaint is there were 3 10-page essays for the class based on very complex readings that he hardly went over in class, making it really hard to write them

Klett is funny, likable, and a good professor overall. However, the study guides he provides for the midterm and final are not at all reflective of what is on the actual exam. His power point style is minimalistic; he usually puts up a word or phrase and then elaborates verbally for 15ish minutes, so it's best to attend lecture for a good grade.

Had 5 "media journals" throughout the quarter, which led up to a group presentation, both of which were fairly straight-forward. There was also a 10-15 page paper as the final (no in class testing), but it's on the same topic as your presentation & media journals, so pretty easy. Great class overall, super interesting material and great lectures!

Klett's first few quarters here at UCSC are phenomenal so far, and it shows in the way he commands his class. He is very clear cut with his assignments, but also sprinkles in some of his young professor charm in his lectures to spice it up. Grades are evenly distributed 20% across all things in class, so he's a forgiving grader. If you can TAKE HIM

It was Joe's second quarter teaching at UCSC I thought he was amazingHe definitely teaches in an unusual way but I liked itHe showed great videos that related to the lecture and would always have music playing in the beginning of classMidterm final are pretty easy if you go back through notes readings and do the study guide Pretty cute too

Very smart, entertaining, really clever use of analogies, and young. To me it was very inspirational taking a class with a young professor, it definitely motivated me to keep pursuing my career passion.   Exams were just right if you did your readings (both core and plus readings), and revised lecture notes.

Joe is an awesome professor! He's a really smart, funny, understanding person and is passionate about what he is teaching. All his lectures are very interesting, he shows a lot of videos which relate to the back to the lectures.
Loved this class. Professor Klett is very engaging, passionate about the material, and super knowledgeable. Also pretty funny and approachable.
Very prepared for his lectures and enthusiastic about the topic. Offers interesting perspectives. The reading is definitely important but you don't have to understand every word.

Klett is a great professor. I learned a lot in his class. Not too hard of a class, very clear cut. If you do the work you'll get a B. The material isn't difficult to understand either. Just go to class. If you miss a couple not a huge deal.

It seems like this is Joe's first quarter as a teacher with the way he lectures, but he's passionate about the subject so much,  you forget the awkwardness. There's a sufficient amount of reading, but everything is interesting and relevant to the class so it's not too bad. Would definitely recommend!!!

We had Three 500 word papers throughout the quarter super easy, some in class group work so not bad at all. the final is take home. He's clear in his lectures, and makes sure you know where the class is and where is heading. Knows his stuff. His points are interesting but sometimes not fully developed. gets people to participate. super approachable

He talks very sophisticated and is often hard to understand. He makes some ideas more complex than they really need to be, but has a lot of interesting ideas if you can concentrate very very hard to pay attention. Super interesting and REALLY knows what he's talking. Focuses on more political ideas as well.
